comment: My only complaint is that he does take forever to get back to you, if something is wrong expect at least a week if not more before you get a response. besides that, he is absolutely amazing

CRJU 3332. For an online class, this class requires A TON of time and work. If you are prepared to take on reading and writing heavy WEEKLY discussions, weekly quizzes with lockdown, an 8-page final paper, and a few assignments here and there, then take his class. Upper-division CJ major here, a C was the best I could do and that says a lot.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Ricks is so easy and very down to earth. He is very entertaining and has some amazing personal stories and definitely knows what he's talking about. Quizzes and tests are both very easy and we had one paper due at the end of the semester, nothing fancy. Def take him because he is so fun to listen to, genuinely enjoyed this class so much!
The assignments in this class were not too hard. Just be prepared for the exams and the amount of writing you will need to do for the research paper.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: Professor Ricks is a great person, and he cares about the subject material and his students. However, his grading system is test heavy, there is little extra credit, and in the last week, 40% of your grade is determined in the by a final exam and a research paper. There are no resources like videos, only a weekly PowerPoint and the textbook.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: He is super laid back and makes class interesting.

Professor Ricks was HANDS DOWN my favorite professor of all time! Going into this class, I was nervous because I have an unpopular view on some current social issues. However, he created an environment that was welcoming and safe for all different points of view. He balances heavy topics with light humor and makes lectures interesting and enjoyable

He is a great professor. Has cool stories to tell. Very very easy test, as long as you take notes on the power points, you will pass. No trick questions on tests, very straightforward. He's nice and he wants all his students to actually pass. Interesting lectures. Would 100% recommend, one of the best professors at KSU for sure!

comment: He is an easy going professor, but you need to go to class to get a good grade. The lectures are very interesting and easy to follow. I would 100% take this class again with him.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: I LOVE Professor Ricks!! He is such a genuine person and really cares about his students success. Hes more than happy to help if you reach out. Utilize the study guides, take notes in class, ask questions, and you will get an A. 10/10 recommend, TAKE HIM!!!
this was my favorite class this semester. this professor is fantastic. the class is interesting and it isnt super hard.

Professor Ricks was my favorite professor this year. If you are struggling with ANYTHING, do not be afraid to reach out. He is extremely understanding and more than willing to work with you if you communicate with him. Attendance is not required. He allows his students to freely express their opinions. If you have the opportunity to take him, do it

If you take notes you are set for the entire semester. Everything from PowerPoints are directly on all tests, if you pay attention the slightest bit you will pass. Attendance is not required, but coming isn't bad, not a waste of time whatsoever. He works at a police department which makes the class even more interesting. This is one of the best!

Professor Ricks is always very straightforward in his teaching and extremely flexible in attendance. Although he does prefer you to attend, this sem he posted every lecture online which made missing class less detrimental. The content is interesting despite it being presented in powerpoints/videos. We had 4 tests, 1 paper, and 1 final. Take him!!

Love prof Ricks, definitely recommend this class! He is by far one of my favorite teachers I've had, you can tell he really cares and is genuinely a good guy. TONS of opportunity for extra credit and he basically tells you exactly what's on the tests. If you ever get the opportunity take this class!!

Professor Ricks is a great professor. He does his job well and cares about his students. He won't hand you an A, but if you do the work, you will make an A. His study guides and review sessions were super helpful. There are 4 tests, a final, one course paper, and he offered extra credit. If you want a job in criminal justice, take this class!
